snippet: Some experts fear that testing the United States’ arsenal for the first time since 1992 would risk an arms race. But some worry about whether the weapons still work....
abstract: Former Texas Gov Rick Perry, if confirmed as energy secretary, will likely face pressure to resume underground testing of nuclear weapons and designing of new types of bombs; some experts worry that as nonscientist with no expertise in nuclear or technical matters, Perry could make decisions that lead country into new arms race.

byline.contributor: William J. Broad and Maggie Haberman contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Some experts fear that testing the United States’ arsenal for the first time since 1992 would risk an arms race. But some worry about whether the weapons still work.

headline.main: Rick Perry, as Energy Secretary, May Be Pressed to Resume Nuclear Tests
headline.print_headline: As Energy Secretary, Perry May Be Pressed to Resume Nuclear Tests
